name: PutEmployeeByEmployeeId
description:
__Activity name :__ PutEmployeeByEmployeeId Edit the employee details
Possible values for fields of the type 'metadata' can be acquired (GET) by adding `/metadata` to the URL

employeeId.description: The unique identifier of the employee

Authorization.description: A valid Bearer token for authorizing the request.

Accept.description: The accept header is used to influence what type of output is returned and in most cases the version of the output

$ul: **obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
**isoCode**: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 value for the country
**key**: The key for the country. Posible values can be aquired via the metadata endpoint
**key**: The key of the further indication ('nadere aanduiding'). Posible values can be aquired via the metadata endpoint
**value**: The description of the further indication ('nadere aanduiding'), the posible values are "WW" and "AB"
**houseNumberAddition**: An addition to further specify the house/door/postbox. For example used to specifty a room of floor number in addition to the house number.
**location**: The location like to further specify the address
**postalCode**: The postal code of the address, only nullable if country is not The Netherlands (NL).
**emailAddress**: The e-mail address of the employee.
**faxNumber**: The fax number to contact this individual
**mobilePhoneNumber**: The mobile phone number of the employee.
**phoneNumber**: The phone number of the employee.
**isoCode**: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 value for the country
**key**: The key for the country. Possible values can be aquired by the metadata endpoint
**key**: The key of the further indication. Possible values can be aquired by the metadata endpoint
**value**: The description of the further indication, the posible values are "WW" and "AB"
**houseNumberAddition**: An addition to further specify the house/door/postbox. For example used to specifty a room of floor number in addition to the house number.
**location**: The location like to further specify the address
**postalCode**: The postal code of the address, only nullable if country is not The Netherlands (NL).
**employeeNumber**: The employee number to uniquely identify an employee within an employer
**exclusionFromAbsenceStatus**: Indicates whether the employee is excluded for any information of absence
**id**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**key**: The key for the type of document. Posible values can be aquired via the metadata endpoint
**value**: Description of the type of document
**aowDate**: The date when, according to Dutch law, the person has the right to a state pension. The value is generated by the system based on the date of birth.
**civilStatus**: The civil/marital status of the employee
**firstName**: The first name, given name, forename or Christian name as part of a persons personal name.
**formattedName**: Formatted name of the employee based on the value of `howToFormatLastName`
**howToFormatLastName**: Indicates how the system will format the last name.
**lastName**: The last name, family name or surname as part of a persons personal name.
**lastNamePartner**: The last name of the employee's partner.
**key**: The key for the nationality. Posible values can be aquired via the metadata endpoint

**photo**: A photo of the employee to use as a avatar/profile picture. The last part of the returned endpoint is the version of the logo this allows users to cache the image. Changing the value of the version will not influence the output.
**prefix**: The prefix to the last name
**prefixPartner**: The prefix to the last name of the employee's partner.
**title**: The title to be used (if any).
**revokeEmployeeSelfServiceAccessOn**: The date on which the Employee will be automatically blocked.

**statusEmployeeSelfService**: The status of the accessability of the Employee Self Service application. In case ESS is not relevant the object will be returned as NULL. Possible values can be acquired via the metadata endpoint
**travelDistanceToWork**: The one way distance in metres the employee has to travel to work.
**obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
